docs.snippet: Less than three weeks before the start of the World Cup, the United States still cannot get its full team together.     When the Americans play Uruguay today at R.F.K. Stadium in Washington, the first of three exhibition games over eight days, they...
docs.lead_paragraph: Less than three weeks before the start of the World Cup, the United States still cannot get its full team together. When the Americans play Uruguay today at R.F.K. Stadium in Washington, the first of three exhibition games over eight days, they will be missing midfielders Claudio Reyna, John O'Brien and Eddie Lewis, along with goalkeeper Kasey Keller. All four are in Europe this weekend for their clubs' final games of the season.
docs.abstract: US will play Uruguay in World Cup exhibition game without players Claudio Reyna, John O'Brien, Eddie Lewis and Kasey Keller, all playing for club teams in Europe (S)

headline.main: U.S. Team to Miss Four at Exhibition

docs.snippet: DAMARCUS BEASLEY has heard all the knocks on soccer. It's a foreign game. It's a girls' game. And it most certainly is not an African-American game.    ''I didn't listen,'' Beasley said.
docs.lead_paragraph: DAMARCUS BEASLEY has heard all the knocks on soccer. It's a foreign game. It's a girls' game. And it most certainly is not an African-American game. ''I didn't listen,'' Beasley said.
docs.abstract: George Vecsey Sports of The Times column discusses strong performance of US national soccer player DeMarcus Beasley at World Cup exhibition game against Uruguay, defying stereotypes that top soccer players are mostly foreign and rarely African-American; photo (M)

headline.main: Sports of The Times; The Next Wave May Have Landed

docs.snippet: There are 10 players age 30 or older on the United States' World Cup roster, but it is the younger players who provide speed and energy and the possibility of unexpected achievement.    Today, as the Americans began a final week of tuneup matches, it...
docs.lead_paragraph: There are 10 players age 30 or older on the United States' World Cup roster, but it is the younger players who provide speed and energy and the possibility of unexpected achievement. Today, as the Americans began a final week of tuneup matches, it was the youngest player -- the 19-year-old midfielder DaMarcus Beasley -- whose searing pace and opportunism produced one goal and set up another as the United States defeated feisty Uruguay, 2-1, before 30,413 at Robert F. Kennedy Stadium.
docs.abstract: US defeats Uruguay, 2-1, in World Cup exhibition match; photo (M)

headline.main: Beasley Sends The World A Message

docs.snippet: The wave of serious injuries that has struck World Cup powers like Italy, Germany and England has now also affected the lineup of the United States.    As his teammates had feared, the starting defensive midfielder Chris Armas tore the anterior...
docs.lead_paragraph: The wave of serious injuries that has struck World Cup powers like Italy, Germany and England has now also affected the lineup of the United States. As his teammates had feared, the starting defensive midfielder Chris Armas tore the anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee during Sunday's 2-1 exhibition victory over Uruguay in Washington. He will miss the World Cup, the national team announced late Sunday night.
docs.abstract: US national team midfielder Chris Armas will not play in World Cup after tearing ligament in knee during exhibition game (M)

headline.main: Knee Injury Ends Armas's Cup Dream

headline.main: After Having Lived His Dream, Ramos Says It's Time to Move On

docs.snippet: THE CITY OF YOUR FINAL DESTINATION  By Peter Cameron  312 pages. Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $24.      On a dilapidated country estate, the three relics of a dead South American writer buzz irritably, like wasps trapped in a toppled nest. His widow and...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE CITY OF YOUR FINAL DESTINATION By Peter Cameron 312 pages. Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $24. On a dilapidated country estate, the three relics of a dead South American writer buzz irritably, like wasps trapped in a toppled nest. His widow and his mistress share the main house with inflected mutual wariness. His brother inhabits an old mill nearby, together with a housekeeper-lover, formerly a boy prostitute in Thailand.
docs.abstract: Richard Eder reviews book The City of Your Final Destination by Peter Cameron; photo (M)

headline.main: Finding New Lives in a Writer's Death

docs.snippet: United States Coach Bruce Arena is going to wait until next week before selecting a replacement for the injured defensive midfielder Chris Armas.     Armas, 29, tore the anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee in the first half of the United...
docs.lead_paragraph: United States Coach Bruce Arena is going to wait until next week before selecting a replacement for the injured defensive midfielder Chris Armas. Armas, 29, tore the anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee in the first half of the United States' World Cup warm-up against Uruguay on Sunday. The deadline to submit rosters to FIFA, soccer's governing body, will be Tuesday.
docs.abstract: US national team coach Bruce Arena will select replacement for injured midfielder Chris Armas next week in time to meet World Cup roster deadline (M)

headline.main: U.S. Coach to Wait On Substitution

docs.snippet: It is a nervous time for all 32 countries preparing for the World Cup finals. Players are dropping out at a regular rate with injuries, tired and vulnerable after long seasons in their professional leagues. The United States is not immune. It lost...
docs.lead_paragraph: It is a nervous time for all 32 countries preparing for the World Cup finals. Players are dropping out at a regular rate with injuries, tired and vulnerable after long seasons in their professional leagues. The United States is not immune. It lost its defensive midfielder, Chris Armas, to a torn anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee on Sunday. That is why Coach Bruce Arena may want to consider swaddling Brian McBride in Bubble Wrap. McBride, 29, scored the only goal for the United States in the 1998 World Cup. A 6-foot-1-inch forward, he excels in the air and is reliable with his back to the goal. Yet soccer forwards, like boxers, lead with their faces. It is an occupational hazard. There is no padded protection against the lance of an elbow or the slam of a head. Since the last World Cup, McBride has twice had shattered cheekbones reconstructed and has undergone two operations for a rare clotting disorder in his right arm.
docs.abstract: Columbus Crew soccer player Brian McBride is expected to join US national World Cup team after three seasons of injuries and health problems; photo (M)

headline.main: Now the Easy Part: McBride Is Healthy

docs.snippet: The United States soccer team again received encouraging performances from its younger players in overwhelming Jamaica, 5-0, tonight. Victory, however, was tempered by the fact that injuries in this exhibition game nearly matched the number of goals....
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States soccer team again received encouraging performances from its younger players in overwhelming Jamaica, 5-0, tonight. Victory, however, was tempered by the fact that injuries in this exhibition game nearly matched the number of goals. Josh Wolff scored twice, Clint Mathis and DaMarcus Beasley added goals and Landon Donovan delivered two assists and a goal for the counterattacking Americans before 30,659 at Giants Stadium. But, with the World Cup finals beginning in just over two weeks, the United States can ill afford the injuries.
docs.abstract: US defeats Jamaica, 5-0, in World Cup exhibition match but injuries to US players worry team on eve of World cup play; photo (M)

headline.main: Young U.S. Players Excel, but the News Isn't All Good

docs.snippet: The United States soccer team received encouraging news yesterday after several players were injured during Thursday's 5-0 victory over Jamaica at Giants Stadium.    The injuries to Clint Mathis, the team's most reliable scorer, and to goalkeeper...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States soccer team received encouraging news yesterday after several players were injured during Thursday's 5-0 victory over Jamaica at Giants Stadium. The injuries to Clint Mathis, the team's most reliable scorer, and to goalkeeper Kasey Keller were not serious, Coach Bruce Arena said yesterday.
docs.abstract: String of injuries to US national World Cup team is not as serious as feared, with all three players hurt in exhibition match against Jamaica able to return within days (S)
